polished_script:
HOOK: The clients you reject will make you more money than the ones you accept. [ON-SCREEN: REJECT > ACCEPT]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: You see them walk in ‚Äî eight million liquid, needs to close in thirty days. Every agent in the room starts salivating. You're thinking "jackpot." You take the listing, chase the deal, work nights and weekends. [ON-SCREEN: $8M CASH BUYER] Then it implodes at attorney review. Or worse ‚Äî they sue you six months later. Sound familiar? 
[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But here's what Jill Preschel does differently ‚Äî and she's closed over two billion in luxury Manhattan deals.

INSIGHT: Jill told me: "Just because someone has the budget and an urgent need doesn't mean you should move forward." [ON-SCREEN: BUDGET ‚â† READY] Here's her filter: She's not asking if they CAN buy. She's asking if they're actually READY to buy. Because urgency without clarity is a lawsuit waiting to happen. Budget without alignment is a deal that dies in due diligence. [ON-SCREEN: URGENCY + NO CLARITY = LAWSUIT] She's not gatekeeping ‚Äî she's protecting her reputation. And that restraint gets her the next referral from developers who know she only brings serious buyers.

REFRAME: Most agents think their job is closing every lead. Top producers know their job is closing the RIGHT lead. When you say no to wrong-fit clients, you get invited to tables where the right ones sit.

CTA: "What's the last deal you chased that you KNEW wasn't right?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---

CAPTION: The $2B agent who says NO to $8M cash buyers (and why you should too) üí∞‚ùå
HASHTAGS: #realestate #luxuryrealestate #realestateagent #agentmindset #businessdevelopment
SHAREABLE_MOMENT: "Urgency without clarity is a lawsuit waiting to happen."
PERFORMANCE_NOTES: [1] Emphasize "REJECT" vs "ACCEPT" in hook with hand gestures. [2] Lean in during the 15-second re-hook for intimacy. [3] Slow down on "urgency without clarity" line for screenshot moment.
